Experience HR Business Partner, Robotics Google February 2015  – Present (7 months) Leadership Programs Program Manager, People Development Google August 2014  –  February 2015  (7 months) Mountain View, CA 6-month work assignment TechHR Program Specialist, Global People Programs Google October 2013  –  July 2014  (10 months) Mountain View, CA • Manage critical HR programs for the Tech organization and work with complex project plans and time-sensitive deadlines to ensure success of key HR programs including promotion and performance management. 
• Routinely analyze data and conduct analyses to identify key trends and themes which inform business decisions. 
• Drive innovation and process improvement to anticipate needs, and use new technologies to improve client experience with HR processes. Work with key stakeholders to improve programs at the design level. Tech Intern Programs Specialist Google May 2010  –  October 2013  (3 years 6 months) Mountain View, CA Program Manager for Google's Engineering Practicum Internship (formerly known as BOLD Practicum): 
• Manage and oversee the recruiting, planning, and implementation of key internship program, which has led to 85+ full-time engineering hires to date. This internship program targets underrepresented students in computer science, and is crucial for Google's diversity hiring pipeline. 
• Grew internship program by 190% in North America and expanded the program to 4 international offices. 
• Lead team of 7 recruiters, 6 recruiting coordinators, and 4 program coordinators across distributed offices. 
• Partner closely with engineering executive stakeholders (5 Engineering Directors & 1 VP) on hiring committees, program strategy and vision. 
• Designed and managed curriculum for the program, encompassing both technical and non-technical courses. 
• Manage relationships with 110 engineering intern hosts across North America. Train and regularly advise hosts on project design, intern management, and intern performance. Serve as Human Resources point of contact for hosts. 
• Oversee 120 interns across 5 locations. Serve as main point of contact outside of the engineering organization. Work directly with interns on questions and situations related to the program, project, and human resources topics. 
• Manage intern performance review process and conversion. 
• Received several spot bonuses from management and multiple peer bonuses for quality of work and impact. 
 
University Outreach and Recruiting: 
 
• Formerly, managed technical campus recruiting programs at nine universities. Worked closely with dozens of Google engineers, Computer Science faculty and staff to hire top technical talent for intern and full-time positions. 
• Planned and held 70+ recruiting events on-campus. Increased student application rate by 174% compared to team average of 105%. Learning and Development Specialist Google October 2008  –  April 2010  (1 year 7 months) Mountain View, CA • Trained 450+ clients in classroom, webinar, and onsite training with a 100% client satisfaction rate. Surpassed the team goal of 90% client satisfaction by 10%. Invited to deliver trainings to top agency clients across North America, including Ogilvy, Digitas, Publicis Groupe, and Carat. 
• Managed entire training curriculum for the DoubleClick Search product, including creating/updating online courses, videos, and presentations Account Strategist Google July 2007  –  September 2008  (1 year 3 months) Mountain View, CA • Managed 300+ accounts generating $13+ million in quarterly revenue. • Led account management team of 2 other members 
• Conceived and presented 2008 Google advertising strategy to 100+ employees of IAC/InterActiveCorp, a Fortune 500 Company, at the annual Google-InterActiveCorp Strategy Summit  
• Mentored Account Coordinators to prepare them for the Account Manager role Q1 AdWords Ambassador to Google Beijing Google January 2008  –  March 2008  (3 months) Beijing, China • Selected from a competitive pool of applicants to serve as the Mountain View Ambassador to the Google Beijing AdWords Team. • Trained and mentored employees in the host office and worked on special projects. Summary Justin Angsuwat has ten years of both consulting and in-house HR experience, leading HR strategy, planning and execution. He currently provides HR partnership at Google to Philipp Schindler, SVP Global Sales & Operations, who leads 15,000+ employees globally. Justin also leads a small team to drive people strategy directly for 5 VPs, 36 Directors, and their organizations. 
 
Prior to this, Justin spent three years as the HR Chief of Staff at a Fortune 500 company during the largest corporate transformation in the world at the time. He then led human capital consulting teams at PwC for three years, before joining Google as a lead HR Business Partner. 
 
Justin was previously named the Australian HR Rising Star of the Year, and was the Chair of the SHRM Young Professionals Board.
